intro: Schefflera tamdaoensis, commonly known as the Tam Dao Schefflera, is a species of flowering plant native to Vietnam. It belongs to the Araliaceae family and is characterized by its compound leaves with multiple leaflets arranged in a distinctive umbrella-like pattern. The plant produces small, greenish-white flowers that are clustered in umbels, followed by red berries that are a notable feature of the species. It thrives in humid, tropical environments and is often found in mountainous regions with well-drained soil. Due to its unique appearance and limited distribution, it is considered a rare and valuable species in botanical studies.
